item.title: Co-Creating DAHRSE Midlands: Vision, Voices, and Next Steps
item.description: On 5th November 2025, the Digital Arts and Humanities Research Software Engineers Midlands (DAHRSE Midlands) community gathered online for its first meeting. The theme “Co-Creating DAHRSE Midlands: Vision, Voices, and Next Steps” was all about collaboration, inclusivity, and building momentum for Digital Arts and Humanities Research Software Engineering in the Midlands. The DAHRSE Midlands community is growing as a collaborative space for Digital Arts and Humanities Research Software Engineers (RSEs) across the region.

item.title: Call for Short Talks – DAHRSE-Midlands 2025 (5 Nov, University of Warwick)
item.description: DAHRSE-Midlands 2025 will take place at the University of Warwick. DAHRSE Midlands 2025 will take place on Wednesday 5th November 2025. For more detials on submitting a talk, please go to DAHRSE Midlands 2025 page.

item.title: DAHRSE-Midlands 2025
item.description:
Post-Event Update: The DAHRSE-Midlands workshop originally planned as an in-person event was delivered in a scaled-down online format on 5th November 2025. This adjustment allowed us to maintain the workshop’s core objectives while making participation more accessible for our community. Despite the change in format, the event successfully fostered collaboration and knowledge exchange among attendees.

You are invited to submit a short talk for Digital Arts and Humanities Research Software Engineers in the Midlands 2025 (DAHRSE-Midlands 2025)—a regional event that brings together research software engineers and related professionals, such as digital Research Technical Professionals, working in the digital humanities and arts across the UK Midlands.

Wednesday 5th November 2025 sees the first edition of the DAHRSE Midlands meeting. This year’s event is being hosted by the Dr Godwin Yeboah at the University of Warwick’s Scarman building, and is sponsored by SSI (the Software Sustainability Institute).

This year’s inaugural meeting is a chance to build community, meet new and old friends, and learn more about the incredible breadth of skills DAHRSEs in the Midlands possess.

Registration

We didn’t want finances to be a barrier to any attendees, and so the Software Sustainability Institute has generously offered support with any travel expenses. People are able to enquire if they would like to take advantage of this help.

Location and travel

Location

The conference will be held in the Scarman Building, Scarman Road, University of Warwick, Coventry, CV4 7SH. The location is easy to find and we provided additional information on How to find Scarman building. You may also be interested in a virtual tour! The location is easy to find and we provided additional information as follows:

  • Google Maps

  • What3Words

  • OpenStreetMap

  • University of Warwick Interactive Campus Map showing Scarman Conference Centre

Travel

The University provided information for travel to the University of Warwick Conferences locations: https://warwick.ac.uk/services/conferences/location

Train

If you were travelling by train, Coventry is on the West Coast Mainline and serviced by regular trains from London Euston, Birmingham (New Street and International) and Leicester. It was easy to get a taxi or bus from Coventry Train Station so you may have had to book a taxi in advance if you prefer not to walk.

Please note that Canley and Tile Hill train stations do not have taxi ranks. These stations are served by trains from Birmingham, London, Milton Keynes, Coventry, Northampton and Rugby. You could have gotten a bus to us from close to the stations.

Bus

If you were travelling by train, there are regular buses from the Coventry rail station, Coventry city centre as well as Leamington Spa. You could have easily gotten taxis from these locations.

The 11 and 12 bus routes may be ideal from Coventry. Both buses call at the Rail Station Bridge stop on Warwick Road; this stop is few minutes walk from Coventry station as shown on Google maps.

The U1 and U2 buses may be ideal from Leamington Spa. Both services stop at Parish Church Stand B; a seven-minute walk from Leamington Spa station as shown on Google maps.

Car

If you were travelling by car, the postcode for Scarman building is CV4 7SH and it is located within the University of Warwick campus.

Scarman conference centre is located on central campus, which is signposted off Gibbet Hill Road. Both static and interactive central campus are available from the provided links.

Further practical information

Warwick Conferences provide general information for delegates at Scarman events.

Car parks are marked on the PDF campus map, anyone coming by car is recommended to park in the Scarman car park (turn off towards the Scarman building and continue past reception to the car park behind the building).

Organising Committee

Our organising committee for this year is being led by Godwin Yeboah. Please get in touch if you would like to join the committee.

Our organising committee for this year is being led by Godwin Yeboah. Please get in touch if you would like to join the organising committee (Catherine Smith, Iain Emsley, Godwin Yeboah).

Sponsor(s)

item.title: DAHRSE-Midlands Community Showcase
item.description: Welcome to the DAHRSE-Midlands Community Showcase! Here, we highlight the profiles and contributions of Digital Arts and Humanities Research Software Engineers across the Midlands.

item.title: The Prospects of Digital Arts and Humanities Research Software Engineers in the Midlands for AHRC Doctoral Landscape Awards
item.description: In recent years, the integration of digital technologies into the arts and humanities has opened new avenues for research and innovation. One of the key drivers of this transformation is the emergence of Digital Arts and Humanities Research Software Engineers (DAHRSEs). These professionals possess a unique blend of technical expertise and a deep understanding of the arts and humanities, making them invaluable assets in the research landscape. The Role of DAHRSE in the Midlands The Midlands region of England, known for its rich cultural heritage and vibrant academic community, is an ideal setting for the growth of DAHRSE.

item.title: DAHRSE-Midlands at the RSE Midlands 2025
item.description: DAHRSE-Midlands will participate in the Software Sustainability Institute (SSI) session at the RSE Midlands 2025 Conference.

item.title: DAHRSE-Midlands at the RSE Midlands 2025
item.description: DAHRSE-Midlands will participate in the Software Sustainability Institute (SSI) session at the RSE Midlands 2025 Conference. RSE Midlands 2025 will take place on Monday 7th April 2025 at The Exchange, hosted by the University of Birmingham’s Advanced Research Computing team. For more detials, please go to RSE Midlands Website - https://rse-midlands.github.io.

item.title: SSI Inaugural Meeting: Announcing New Fellows on January 30, 2025
item.description: SSI Inaugural Meeting: Announcing New Fellows on January 30, 2025

item.title: SSI Inaugural Meeting: Announcing New Fellows on January 30, 2025
item.description: DAHRSE-Midlands awarded Software Sustainability Institute (SSI) Fellowship. The inaugural meeting for announcing the fellowship will take place on Thursday 30 January 14:00-17:00 (GMT). The fellowship will help foster collaboration and innovation among like-minded professionals. The announcement post is at the following SSI webpage Introducing the 2025 Fellowship Cohort: Insights and Celebrations.

item.title: Setting Up a Hugo Site Like DAHRSE-Midlands Website
item.description: Setting up a Hugo site with the Box template on GitHub Pages using GitHub Codespaces and a new repository can streamline your web development process. This guide walks you through the necessary steps, from installing Hugo in VSCode to creating and configuring your repositories, and finally deploying your site. By following these instructions, you’ll have a fully functional Hugo site hosted on GitHub Pages, just like the DAHRSE-Midlands website. Assumptions Visual Studio Code (VSCode) is already installed.
